definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Use a pen to write your name.
sentences.chinese: 用原子笔写下你的名字。

sentences.english: Then he sat down next to Voisin and began to write, carefully, without hurry, a thin legible hand.
sentences.chinese: 他不慌不忙，认认真真地写下一串纤细而清晰的字迹。

sentences.english: Mark down your top three priorities for the day. Everything else should be secondary.
sentences.chinese: 写下一天中最需要做的三件事，剩下的事情都在其次。

sentences.english: Construct your own sentences using the words that you have noted in your dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 用你在个人词库中所写下的单词进行遣词造句。

sentences.english: Some mourners wrote inscriptions on the wooden barriers of the pools.
sentences.chinese: 有些悼念者还在水池旁的木框上写下话语。

sentences.english: Then go back to your problem and write down any ideas that come to mind.
sentences.chinese: 之后再回到你的问题，并写下脑海里冒出的想法。

sentences.english: Remember those questions you wrote down before?
sentences.chinese: 还记得你先前写下的那些问题吗？

sentences.english: Sometimes really ambiguous entries make it on the list because I trust my future self way too much.
sentences.chinese: 有时，我写下含糊不清的条目，这是自视甚高。

sentences.english: You can remember my telephone number if you write it down.
sentences.chinese: 如果你写下我的电话号，你就会记住它。

sentences.english: Next, write down three adjectives that describe you.
sentences.chinese: 接下来，写下三个形容你的形容词。

sentences.english: The waiter smiled as he wrote down our order.
sentences.chinese: 服务员微微一笑，他写下了我们的秩序。

sentences.english: He hoped too write down how much Scrooge would give.
sentences.chinese: 他希望写下史高基捐了多少钱。

sentences.english: I filled in the form and wrote down typing as my training course.
sentences.chinese: 我填写了报名表，并写下了打字作为我的培训科目。

sentences.english: Again I wrote it with a second hand.
sentences.chinese: 我再一次写下她的芳名。

sentences.english: They should write down everything they remember.
sentences.chinese: 他们应该写下他们能记起的所有事。
请写下你共300页的自传的第297页内容。

definition: to take up one's pen/to start to write
to express (emotions in prose)/a written description (of emotions)
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke
to put pen to paper/pen mark
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
